intro: Veronica cuneifolia subsp. cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue-to-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky habitats.
